intro: Diplycosia calelanensis, commonly known as the Calelan's diplycosia, is a flowering plant species native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
